p: Slope aspects significantly affected the abundance of the two shrubs ( Table 3). The abundance R. chrysanthum were large on the north-facing and south-facing slope. The abundance of V. uliginosum were low on all slope aspects, especially, rarely seen on the southeast-facing slope, southwest-facing and east-facing slopes ( Figure 2). No significant difference in the abundance of R. chrysanthum was observed between those on the north-facing and south-facing slope ( p > 0.05), but there were significant differences in those on west-facing, southwest-facing, southeast-facing, and east-facing slopes ( p ≤ 0.05). The abundance of V. uliginosum on the north-facing slope differed significantly with those on other slopes ( p ≤ 0.05) ( Table 3 and Figure 2).
